revised_title: Investigation of Electric Conductivity in Nitric Acid
tldr: The authors investigate the electric conductivity of nitric acid and observe that its specific resistance decreases for percentage concentrations from 1.3% to 30%, then increases slowly until a maximum is reached at 96.22% before reversing. They also find that nitric acid behaves as a metallic conductor with a negative temperature coefficient for high concentrations, and discuss the implications of their findings in relation to the ionic dissociation and hydrate theories of solution.
